meanings.sent1: She couldn't stop adulating her favorite singer after the concert.
meanings.sent2: The fans were adulating the movie star at the red carpet event.
meanings.sent3: The adulating crowd showered the performer with endless compliments.
meanings.sent4: Her adulating words painted a glowing picture of the author's talent.
meanings.sent5: The adulating applause filled the room with warmth and appreciation.

meanings.definition: To behave in an obsequious manner
meanings.sent1: He was adulating his boss in hopes of getting a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The servant was adulating the nobleman to gain favor.
meanings.sent3: The adulating waiter hovered attentively around the demanding customer.
meanings.sent4: Her adulating gestures bordered on servility in front of the queen.
meanings.sent5: The adulating behavior of the courtier was met with raised eyebrows.

meanings.definition: To flatter or fawn over someone
meanings.sent1: She was adulating her friend's new haircut, even though it looked terrible.
meanings.sent2: The politician was adulating the voters to win their support.
meanings.sent3: The adulating aunt praised her nephew's mediocre painting as a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His adulating compliments were as transparent as glass.
meanings.sent5: The adulating tone of her voice made him suspicious of her true intentions.
